text:
Hello, hopefully this is the right place to ask this. I am following the simple tutorials on <https://yaoquantum.org/tutorials/quick-start/2.yao_basics/>. Trying the very frist example on the REPL
```using Yao, YaoPlots

A(i, j) = control(i, j => shift(2π/(i << (i - j + 1))))
B(n, k) = chain(n, j == k ? put(k => H) : A(j, k) for j in k:n)
qft(n) = chain(B(n, k) for k in 1:n)

plot(qft(3))```
Put this generates a lengthy text output and doesn't display the circuit. It work perfectly fine in a jupyter notebook, but I also use the REPL a lot for my workflow. Anyone have any ideas what could be causing this? I post the output if it's helpful, it's just kinda lengthy

attachments.title: Yao - Quantum Computing in Julia
attachments.text: The official website for the Yao framework. Yao is a framework for quantum computing in JuliaLanguage. Click here to learn more.

. Trying the very frist example on the REPL

using Yao, YaoPlots

text:
<@U016AJ3TWUD>
The fastest and most efficient thing would be....
```function disp(a)
   if Sys.iswindows()
      run(`$a`)
   elseif Sys.isapple()
      run(`open $a`)
   else
      run(`xdg-open $a`)
   end
end

using Compose,Yao,YaoPlots
A(i, j) = control(i, j => shift(2π/(i << (i - j + 1))))
B(n, k) = chain(n, j == k ? put(k => H) : A(j, k) for j in k:n)
qft(n) = chain(B(n, k) for k in 1:n)
plot(qft(3)) |> SVG("img.svg"); disp("img.svg")```

But I don't think you'd want to write that....:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

Pluto is really easy to get started with, that page you sent and the following tutorials are all written in Pluto
